## TIER 5: ETHIOPIA, DRC, SOUTH AFRICA

### ETHIOPIA

#### Tax Regime
- **Corporate Tax Rate:** 30% on adjusted business income (applies equally to foreign and national companies)
- **Withholding Tax Rates:**
  - **Dividends:** 10% (resident and non-resident)
  - **Interest:** 5% (resident), 10% (non-resident)
  - **Royalties:** 5% (resident and non-resident)
  - **Technical Service Fees:** 2% (resident), 15% (non-resident)
  - **Management/Technical Fees (Non-Residents):** 15% of gross amount
  - **Insurance Premium (Non-Residents):** 5% of gross amount
- **2024 Changes (Effective):**
  - **WHT on Goods/Services:** Increased to 3% on goods (>ETB 20,000) and services (>ETB 10,000) from previous 2%
  - **Minimum Alternative Tax (MAT):** 2.5% of turnover if declared tax falls below 2.5% threshold (applies regardless of tax incentives)
  - **Undistributed/Repatriated Profits Tax:** 15% on profits not reinvested or remitted within 12 months (increased from 10%)
- **Treaty Rates (where applicable):**
  - **Interest (Bank Loans from Contracting State):** 5%
  - **Dividends (Beneficial Owner with ≥10% Capital):** 5%
  - **Dividends (Pension Funds):** 5%
- **Source:** [Ethiopia Corporate Tax PWC](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/ethiopia/corporate/taxes-on-corporate-income), [Ethiopia Withholding Taxes](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/ethiopia/corporate/withholding-taxes)

#### Central Bank Circulars & Regulations
- **Regulatory Authority:** National Bank of Ethiopia (NBE)
- **Key Directive:** Minimum Paid-up Capital and Capital Adequacy Requirement (3rd Replacement) MFI-36-2023 (issued April 25, 2023)

- **Minimum Paid-Up Capital:**
  - **Current Requirement:** ETB 75 million (increased from ETB 10 million)
  - **Effective Date:** January 16, 2023
  - **Rationale:** Improve MFIs' capacity to serve growing customer needs and foster public trust
  - **Source:** [NBE Raises MFI Capital to 75M Birr](https://ethiopianmonitor.com/2023/01/21/nbe-raises-minimum-paid-up-capital-for-mfi-to-75mln-birr/), [Central Bank Sevenfolds Microfinance Capital](https://www.thereporterethiopia.com/30020/)

- **Operational Restrictions:**
  - **Loan Limit:** MFIs prohibited from giving loans exceeding 1% of their capital
  - **Example:** MFI with ETB 20 million capital can only loan maximum ETB 200,000
  - **Source:** [NBE Selected Directives](https://www.scribd.com/document/694218054/NBE-Selected-Directives)

- **Foreign Ownership:**
  - **Status:** Financial services (banking, insurance, microfinance) historically reserved for domestic investors ONLY
  - **2025 Change:** New Banking Business Proclamation (1360/2025) lifts restriction for BANKING business only
  - **Microfinance:** Remains CLOSED to foreign ownership
  - **Insurance:** Remains CLOSED to foreign ownership
  - **Source:** [Ethiopia Banking Sector Liberalization](https://www.mondaq.com/financial-services/1668322/liberalization-of-ethiopias-banking-sector-to-foreign-investment)

- **MFI to Bank Transitions:**
  - **Pioneer MFIs Allowed to Transform:** Amhara MFI, Oromia MFI, Omo MFI, Addis MFI
  - **Incomplete Transition:** Dedebit MFI allowed but did not complete transformation
  - **Source:** NBE directives on MFI transitions

#### Licensing Requirements
- **Application:** Submit to National Bank of Ethiopia
- **Capital:** ETB 75 million minimum paid-up capital
- **Ownership:** Domestic investors only (foreign ownership prohibited)
- **Loan Limits:** Max 1% of capital per loan
- **Timeline:** Not specified in available sources
- **Source:** NBE Microfinance Business directives

### DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO (DRC)

#### Tax Regime
- **Corporate Tax Rate:** 30% (including mining companies)
- **Taxation Basis:** Territorial/source basis for residents and companies
- **Minimum Tax:** 1% of yearly turnover for companies other than micro/small-sized (applies to loss-making companies and companies with CIT <1% of turnover)
- **Branch Taxation:** Branches pay 30% corporate tax PLUS 20% tax based on 50% of net profits after CIT deduction (deemed distributed profits)
- **VAT Rates:**
  - **Standard:** 16%
  - **Reduced:** 8% on frozen horse mackerel, salted fish, bovine meat (fresh/chilled), husked rice, milk powder, packaged table water, iodized salt, soap, matches, air ticket sales
  - **Zero-Rated:** 0% on exports and assimilated transactions
- **VAT Exemptions:** Some banking/financial services, education, medical services, charitable/social activities, transactions subject to specific taxation
- **Withholding Tax:**
  - **Standard Rate:** 20% on dividends, royalties, interest, directorship fees (gross amount)
  - **Mining Sector Dividends:** 10% (reduced rate)
  - **Interest (Mining Companies on Foreign Currency Loans Borrowed Abroad):** 0%
  - **Royalties:** 20% on NET amount (70% of invoiced amount after 30% deduction)
- **Rental Income Tax (Kinshasa):** 22% (20% withheld by tenant, 2% paid by landlord)
- **Import Fees:**
  - **OCC (Congolese Control Office):** 1.5% of CIF value
  - **OGEFREM:** 0.58% of CIF value
  - **FPI (Promotion of Industry):** 2% of CIF value
  - **BIVAC Inspection:** 1.5% of FOB value
- **Source:** [DRC Corporate Tax PWC](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/democratic-republic-of-the-congo/corporate/taxes-on-corporate-income), [DRC Tax Rates](https://www.lloydsbanktrade.com/en/market-potential/democratic-republic-of-congo/taxes)

#### Central Bank Circulars & Regulations
- **Regulatory Authority:** Central Bank of Congo (BCC)
- **Mandate:** Control over banks, non-bank credit/savings cooperatives, specialized financial institutions, finance companies, microfinance institutions, money transfer institutions, financial messaging services
- **Legal Power:** Approve banking institutions, control compliance, take corrective measures for financial system safety/soundness, establish regulatory/prudential rules

- **Microfinance Capital Requirements:**
  - **Minimum Capital:** USD 700,000 (or equivalent in Congolese francs) for full microfinance companies
  - **Legal Framework:** Law No. 11/020 (September 15, 2011), revised 2017
  - **Supplemental Regulation:** BCC Instruction No. 10 on capital requirements
  - **Source:** [DRC Banking Laws 2024](https://www.globallegalinsights.com/practice-areas/banking-and-finance-laws-and-regulations/congo-d-r/), [Congo Lending License Guide](https://blog.lendsqr.com/congo-lending-license/)

- **Commercial Banks:**
  - **Minimum Capital:** USD 50 million (deadline: end of 2020)
  - **Source:** [DRC Banking Capital Requirements](https://www.theafricareport.com/12494/drcs-banking-capital-requirements-raise-prospects-of-consolidation/)

- **Current MFI Sector Status (2024):**
  - **Registered Non-Cooperative MFIs:** 23 (officially recognized by BCC)
  - **Historical Context:** 37 MFIs bankrupted in 2013; 63 licenses withdrawn by BCC
  - **Sector Decline:** Number of MFIs decreased 26.6% over last decade
  - **Governance Issues:** BCC revised regulations and developed standard reporting templates following diagnostic highlighting systemic risks
  - **Commercial Banks (2024):** 16 approved commercial banks operating across Kinshasa, Haut-Katanga, Nord-Kivu provinces
  - **Source:** [DRC Banking on the Future](https://verdant-cap.com/banking-on-the-future-drc/), [DRC MFW4A Profile](https://www.mfw4a.org/country/democratic-republic-congo)

#### Licensing Requirements
- **Application:** Submit to Central Bank of Congo (BCC)
- **Capital:** USD 700,000 for microfinance institutions
- **Required Documentation:**
  - Comprehensive business plan (lending strategy, target market, loan products, risk management, financial projections)
  - Proof of financial capacity (capital sources, liquidity management)
  - Shareholder and management details (backgrounds, financial disclosure)
  - Corporate governance structure (experienced board, executives)
- **Capital Evidence:** Available capital meeting BCC standards, legal source documentation, clear capital structure
- **Source:** BCC licensing framework

### SOUTH AFRICA

#### Tax Regime
- **Corporate Tax Rate:** 27% flat rate (for tax years ending on/after March 31, 2023; applies to 2024-2025)
- **Small Business Corporations (SBCs):** Tiered structure
  - **0%:** Taxable income up to ZAR 95,750
  - **Incremental rates** up to **27%** on income over ZAR 550,000
- **Special Economic Zones (SEZs):** 15% lowered corporate tax rate
- **VAT Rate:** 15% standard rate (effective from May 1, 2025; proposed increases reversed)
- **VAT Registration Threshold:** ZAR 1,000,000 annual turnover
- **IFRS 9 "Covered Persons" (Banks):** Dividends hedging tax-deductible liabilities taxed to match accounting treatment
- **FLAC Instruments:** Tax treatment clarified for First Loss After Capital instruments mandated by Prudential Authority
- **Global Minimum Tax (Pillar Two - Effective Jan 1, 2024):**
  - **Applicable to:** MNE groups with annual consolidated revenue ≥ EUR 750 million (~ZAR 15 billion)
  - **Top-up Taxes to SARS:** Start 2026/27, projected ZAR 8 billion
  - **Source:** [South Africa Corporate Tax Guide](https://wise.com/gb/blog/south-africa-corporate-tax), [South Africa Corporate Tax PWC](https://taxsummaries.pwc.com/south-africa/corporate/taxes-on-corporate-income)

#### Central Bank Circulars & Regulations
- **Regulatory Authorities:**
  - **SARB (Prudential Authority):** Banks, non-bank deposit-taking institutions
  - **National Credit Regulator (NCR):** Micro-lenders, credit providers
  - **MFSA (Microfinance South Africa):** Represents 1800+ microfinance credit provider offices registered with NCR

- **Capital Requirements:**
  - **Banks (SARB-licensed):** ZAR 250 million minimum capital
  - **Mutual Banks:** ZAR 10 million minimum capital
  - **Foreign Bank Subsidiaries/Branches:** ZAR 250 million minimum capital
  - **Minimum Total Capital Requirement:** At least 11.5%
  - **Minimum Leverage Ratio:** At least 4%
  - **Micro-Lenders (NCR-registered):** Less stringent capital requirements (varies by category)
  - **Source:** [Bank Licensing South Africa](https://www.resbank.co.za/content/dam/sarb/what-we-do/prudential-regulation/functions-of-the-prudential-authority/licensing/Banking%20licencing%20in%20the%20Republic%20of%20South%20Africa%20(2021%20update).pdf), [South Africa Lending License](https://blog.lendsqr.com/how-to-get-a-lending-license-in-south-africa/)

- **Microfinance Intermediaries (via SEFA):**
  - **Minimum Operating Period:** 2 years in microfinance lending
  - **Registration:** Registered and operating within South Africa
  - **Compliance:** Companies Act governance requirements, regulatory compliance, risk management policies, board, reviewers
